text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen I'm 
going to show you how you can turn any leftover

meat that you have into a delicious spicy fresh 
Thai salad now I'm going to use my honey roasted

pork tenderloin from last episode but you can use 
roast chicken leftover pork chops Thanksgiving

turkey steaks anything you like super easy it's 
a really good recipe to have in your repertoire

let's get started I'm essentially making a yum 
which is a type of Thai salad now because I'm

using my roasted pork it is yum Moo Ob Moo is pork 
and ob is to roast yum dressing starts out with

some fresh lime juice always fresh never bottled 
it is so important salty I'm adding some fish

sauce now because I'm using my honey roasted pork 
tenderloin for my sweet I'm going to use the same

honey that went into my pork just to keep with 
the theme but you could do palm sugar you could

do granulated sugar you can even do maple syrup 
if you're in Canada I'm also going to add some

Thai chili paste now use Thai chili paste of many 
recipes before but I wanted to point out not all

Thai chili pastes are the same this particular 
brand I like for salads because it's not quite

as sweet the other one that I use for my thumb iam 
going episode is sweeter and shrimpy err it worked

there but here I think this is a better choice 
just a little bit not much get that mixed up

little chunks are okay that'll go away as you mix 
everything one more thing Thai chili super super

spicy by the way I freeze my Chili's they last 
a very long time that way make it really fine

so you don't end up with big chunks not a pleasant 
surprise now the pork as I said I'm using my honey

roasted pork tenderloin if you want this recipe 
and you missed it up with the link at the end and

also in the description get that in there first 
give it some time to soak up all that dressing

this salad is also great the next day as the 
pork sits in and it just absorbs more of the

dressing whoa all right fresh herbs green onions 
are almost always used in a Thai salad cilantro I

can't think of a Thai salad that doesn't have 
cilantro some onions I'm using red onions you

can use regular yellow onions of you want grape 
tomatoes and now just mix it all up okay so maybe

using a teaspoon isn't the best tool mmm like 
a party in the bowl time to plate now the last

time I made this I also put in some sliced avocado 
into the mix oh that was good if you've got some

sour green mango oh really good in this salad so 
extra lettuce leaves just so you can munch on it

cuz trust me this is going to be spicy lettuce 
can help cool it down a little tada how easy

was that mmm it's fresh it's tart I can imagine 
this being really good with a rotisserie chicken

oh and you can put it in like a little taco you 
can just eat it with rice on its own oh my god

put some lettuce so many things you could do with 
it so the next time you've got some leftover meat

don't forget to turn it into a YUM the recipe is 
on hot Thai Kitchen calm if you make it send me

a photo Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious Thai me

by the way roasted peanuts great on the 
salad okay now I'm done I'm essentially

making a yum and YUM is a type of site of 
size salad I am going to show you how you

can turn any leftover meat that you have 
into a delicious spicy part Thai salad
